member.name: P:MD5StageFileCreator.clsMD5StageFileCreator.PreviewMode
member.summary: Set this to True to display the contents of the new stagemd5 file in the console window

member.name: P:MD5StageFileCreator.clsMD5StageFileCreator.StagingFilePath
member.summary: Full path to the stagemd5 file created by WriteStagingFile

member.name: P:MD5StageFileCreator.clsMD5StageFileCreator.StagingFolderPath
member.summary: Path to the folder in which the stagemd5 file will be created This path is initialized by the class constructor

member.name: M:MD5StageFileCreator.clsMD5StageFileCreator.WriteStagingFile(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Creates a staging file for this dataset, listing each of the files that needs to be restored File paths should look like: /archive/dmsarch/LTQ_ORB_3_1/MG_merc_32_2_21Feb09_Sphinx_08-11-20/MG_merc_32_2_21Feb09_Sphinx_08-11-20.RAW
member.param: List of files to include in the stagemd5 file (full paths)
Name of this dataset; the staging file will be named stagemd5.DatasetName
The path to the parent folder that the dataset resides in on the storage server
If this value is greater than zero, then will append _ExtraFiles### to the stageing file name (e.g. ### will be 001 if intExtraFileNumber = 1)
member.remarks: intExtraFileNumber will get auto-incremented if copy of the staging file to the archive storage path fails with error "cannot access the file '...' because it is being used by another process."
